title: Amazing Race Australia: Catholic nuns Therese Mills and Judy Bowe reveal their advantage
text:
They are set to take on Channel Ten's The Amazing Race.

And sisters Therese Mills and Judy Bowe, from the Missionaries of God's Love Sisters, are touting themselves as the show's most competitive duo.

'The other teams might be a bit threatened by us because we've got the big fella on our side,' Therese says in the first trailer of the new series.

'They might be a bit threatened by us!' Catholic nuns Therese Mills and Judy Bowe revealed their 'big' advantage over the other teams on The Amazing Race is the the power of prayer

In an interview with 10 Daily Judy revealed that their biggest advantage over the other teams - the power of prayer.

'I can pray for endurance, perseverance and courage when I don't have any left.'

While they are leaving their missionary work behind, she said: 'To do The Amazing Race would be to achieve the challenge of a lifetime, where else do you get to do so many crazy, impossible challenges all over the world in a short time.'

Nuns on the run: While they are leaving their missionary work behind, she said: 'To do The Amazing Race would be to achieve the challenge of a lifetime, where else do you get to do so many crazy, impossible challenges all over the world in a short time'

Judy also revealed the one place they would not like to visit while on the race - Israel.

'Because I would hate to go there in a rush, I'd want to stop and pray for days and not run around,' she said.

The Amazing Race Australia's return to screens comes after a five-year hiatus.

New host: Channel 10's new season of The Amazing Race Australia will be hosted by former NRL star Beau Ryan

The recently released teaser trailer hints at some of the stressful, fast-paced and often bizarre challenges the 11 teams will face during their globetrotting adventure.

'This is no vacation. This is The Amazing Race and anything can happen!' says host Beau Ryan.

In The Amazing Race, the teams must take on various challenges across three continents in a bid to win a $250,000 cash prize.

The Amazing Race Australia is coming soon to Channel 10 and WIN
